# Theme selection

Create a backfillz object.

```{r, message=FALSE}
library(backfillz)

x <- as_backfillz(sample_stanfit)
```

The initial theme is default.

```{r}
x@theme_name
```

The themes currently available are default, solarized dark, demo 1 and demo 2.

To select a different theme pass the object to the set_theme function.

```{r}
x <- set_theme(x, theme = "demo 2")
x@theme_name
```

Subsequent plots the object will be in the demo 2 theme.

```{r, message=FALSE, fig.width=10, fig.height=10}
x <- plot_slice_histogram(x, save_plot = FALSE)
```

# Tweaking themes

Themes are a series of parameters stored in the Backfillz object.

```{r}
grep(pattern = 'theme', x = slotNames(x), value = TRUE)
```

Which can be overwritten. 

```{r, fig.width=10, fig.height=10, message=FALSE}
x@theme_text_family <- 'mono'
x <- plot_slice_histogram(x, save_plot = FALSE)
```
